New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 109th international goal and first of the tournament
Messi has 28 goals in his past 25 matches for Argentina and 14 in Copa America play, three shy of the record
Key Match Events: Julián Álvarez put the Albiceleste ahead in the 22nd minute
Messi redirected Enzo Fernández's shot in off goalkeeper Maxime Crépeau in the 51st
Alphonso Davies limped off after his right leg was caught in a clean challenge with Gonzalo Montiel
Canada star Alphonso Davies was replaced in the 71st minute
Jonathan David was thwarted by Emiliano Martínez from close range in first-half stoppage time
Martínez made a kick save on Tani Oluwaseyi in the 80th
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina fans gathered in Times Square on the eve of the match and filled the streets of Manhattan before heading to MetLife Stadium
The crowd of 80,102 on a night with an 82 degree temperature and 82% humidity was overwhelmingly pro-Argentina
Only Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo with 130 has more men's international goals than Messi, who turned 37 on June 24
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi celebrated after scoring a goal against Canada in the Copa America
Argentina extended its unbeaten streak to 10 games
For those who remain from the old guard, it's beyond impressive that the national team is in another final
Argentina had beaten Canada 2-0 in the tournament opener June 20
Miscellaneous Highlights: MetLife's temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles
Argentina went ahead after Rodrigo De Paul from the center circle played a long pass to Álvarez
For Canada, the defeat ends a remarkable run in which they defied expectations and performed better than their higher-ranked Concacaf rivals Mexico and the United States
